value.title: Update: The retirement date for default outbound access has been extended to March 31, 2026.
value.description:
The retirement date for default outbound access has been extended to March 31, 2026. This change aligns with the broader Azure Virtual Network (VNet) update and replaces the previously communicated September 30, 2025 date. 

Starting March 31, 2026, newly created VNets will default to using private subnets. This means: 

  • Explicit outbound connectivity (e.g., via NAT Gateway, UDR, or other methods) must be configured to access public endpoints on the Internet or Microsoft services. 

  • Default outbound access will be disabled by default, but not removed. Customers who do not configure an outbound method will lose internet connectivity from their Batch nodes. 

  • Review your current Batch pool configurations, especially those using simplified node communication without public IPs.

  • Plan to implement an explicit outbound method before the March 2026 deadline. 

Learn more:

  • Read Default Internet outbound access for Simplified node communication Batch pools without public IP addresses will be retired on 30 September 2025.

  • Read How and when default outbound access is provided

  • Read Feature Update: Default behavior for newly created virtual networks will be private

value.title: Public Preview: Azure Databricks Dashboard subscriptions now support Microsoft Teams
value.description:
You can now receive insights where collaboration happens—in Microsoft Teams—with expanded dashboard subscription capabilities in Azure Databricks. This enhancement delivers timely, actionable data directly into team workflows, reducing the need to check email or switch tools. It supports faster decision-making and keeps everyone aligned in real time. As part of the broader Microsoft vision to unify data, AI, and collaboration, this feature helps you connect insights to action within the Microsoft 365 ecosystem. 

Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: Azure Sphere OS version 25.12 is now available for evaluation
value.description:
Azure Sphere OS version 25.12 is now available for evaluation in the Retail Eval feed. Whilst this release encompasses no customer-facing changes, it represents significant under-the-hood build system changes, as such, this release will operate for an extended evaluation period, until February 2026, enabling additional time for customer evaluation testing.

Following this period, a second evaluation release, 26.02, will be launched to the Retail Eval feed for the standard 14-day testing period, and subsequently promoted to the Retail feed. This means that 25.12 will not be promoted to the Retail feed, and that the next Retail release will be 26.02.

During this time, please verify that your applications and devices operate properly with both the 25.12, and subsequent 26.02 release, before it is deployed broadly to devices in the Retail feed. 

The 25.12 OS Retail Eval release includes significant underlying build system updates.

Learn more:

  • For more information on Azure Sphere OS feeds and setting up an evaluation device group, see Azure Sphere OS feeds and Set up devices for OS evaluation.
  • For self-help inquiries or technical support, review the Azure Sphere support options.

value.title: Generally Available: FIPS compliant mode for Application Gateway V2 SKUs
value.description:
The Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) 140-2 is a US government standard that defines minimum security requirements for cryptographic modules in information technology products and systems. 

Azure Application Gateway V2 now supports FIPS mode, which can be enabled during deployment or at any time afterward. When FIPS mode is turned on, the gateway uses only FIPS-compliant predefined and custom TLS policies, enhancing security and helping meet FedRAMP security requirements. 

Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: Zonal placement for Azure file shares Azure Files Premium LRS in select regions.
value.description:
Zonal Placement for Azure Files Premium LRS is now GA in select regions! This capability gives you explicit control over zone locality by pinning storage accounts to a specific availability zone, enabling high availability, fault isolation, and predictable low-latency performance for mission-critical workloads. Why it matters: Align compute and storage in the same zone for 10–40% lower latency compared to cross-zone deployments. Design resilient architectures with zone-aware control for better fault isolation.
Learn more.

value.title: Public Preview: Mistral Large 3 in Foundry
value.description:
Mistral Large 3, a frontier-class open-weight model with Apache 2.0 licensing, is now available in Microsoft Foundry on Azure. This model delivers enterprise-grade reliability, long-context comprehension, and multimodal reasoning—making it ideal for production assistants, retrieval-augmented applications, agentic systems, and multimodal workflows.

Key Capabilities:

  • Highly reliable instruction following
  • Extended context support for long documents and multi-turn conversations
  • Strong multimodal reasoning (text, images, diagrams)
  • Stable, predictable performance for enterprise workloads
  • Fully open and exportable for hybrid or on-premises deployment

Why it matters:
Mistral Large 3 sets a new benchmark for open models, combining frontier-level capability, reproducible results, and worldwide availability without regional restrictions. Organizations can fine-tune, customize, and deploy the model across cloud, edge, or sovereign environments with no attribution requirements.

Pricing:

  • Input: $0.50 per 1M tokens
  • Output: $1.50 per 1M tokens
  • Deployment: Global Standard (West US 3)
Learn more.

value.title: Generally Availaible: Azure MCP Server support for Azure confidential ledger
value.description:
The Azure MCP (Model Context Protocol) Server provides a streamlined approach for managing Azure resources—including Azure confidential ledger—through natural language prompts. This feature allows users to interact with confidential ledger without the need to memorize complex command syntax. Customers can now create an immutable and integrity-protected Azure confidential ledger for logging purposes. Additionally, writing to and reading from the ledger using AI is now fully supported and ready for deployment.


You can connect to Azure MCP Server utilizing a range of tools, programming languages, and frameworks. The server facilitates resource management via natural language conversations, supports the development of automation scripts, and enables integration of Azure operations into various applications. This capability is accessible through Visual Studio Code and GitHub Copilot.

Learn more.

value.title: Public Preview: Serverless workspaces in Azure Databricks
value.description:
Serverless workspaces in Azure Databricks are now available in Public Preview, offering a fully managed workspace type that comes preconfigured with serverless compute and default storage to deliver an enterprise-ready SaaS experience with minimal infrastructure setup. With this release, customers can create Azure Databricks “Serverless” workspaces directly from the Azure portal to run production workloads entirely on serverless compute, rapidly spin up short-lived environments for training and testing, and empower admins who lack direct cloud provisioning permissions to deploy and manage secure, governed Azure Databricks environments at scale. 

Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: Azure Blob Storage SFTP - Resumable Uploads
value.description:
Announcing the general availability of resumable uploads for Azure Storage Blob SFTP. In the event of a failed partial transfer, this new feature enables users to open the partial file and continue writing the remaining content. This capability optimizes time and conserves network bandwidth, especially in situations where network interruptions occur during file transfers, such as in remote areas with low connectivity or when transferring large files like multimedia or seismic data etc.  

Resume Upload  

The resumable upload feature for Azure Blob Storage SFTP is now generally available. This feature allows users to resume file uploads from the point of failure in the event of partial transfer failures, thereby saving time and reducing network bandwidth usage.  

Learn more. 

The SFTP transfer modes that Azure Blob Storage SFTP supports are below: 

  • Write: This mode lets the client continue an upload by adding data to an existing file from a specific point without creating a new file.  
  • Write + Create: This mode allows the client to resume an upload by either adding to an existing file or creating a new one if it doesn't exist, providing flexibility when the file may not be present initially.  
  • Append: This mode adds data to the end of an existing file without overwriting its current contents.  

Resumable upload enhances efficiency by saving time and bandwidth during interrupted file transfers. Please reach out to blobsftp@microsoft.com for feedback about SFTP for Azure Blob Storage.

value.title: Retirement: Remove dependency on these Azure ML SDKs before June 30, 2026
value.description:
On June 30, 2026, AzureML SDK V1 will reach end of life. The following SDKs which work in tandem with the AzureML SDK V1 will also be retired.  

  • azureml-train-core  

  • azureml-pipeline  

  • azureml-pipeline-core  

  • azureml-pipeline-internal  

  • azureml-pipeline-steps  

After June 30, 2026, you can continue to use these SDKs, however they will not be supported and may stop working without notice.  

Recommended action  

To ensure that you are using a supported SDK for your workloads, it is recommended to migrate to AzureML SDK V1 before 30 Jun 2026.  

Detailed guidance is documented here.

Help and support  

If you have questions, get answers from community experts in Microsoft Q&A. If you have a support plan and you need technical help, create a support case.  

Links provided herein may take you to a third-party website and are provided for convenience only. Third-party websites are subject to the third-party's terms and privacy statements.  

Learn more about service retirements that may impact your resources in the Azure Retirement Workbook. Please note that retirements may not be visible in the workbook for up to two weeks after being announced.

value.title: Generally Available: The credcheck extension in Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server
value.description:
Now you can install the credcheck extension in Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server. The credcheck extension helps you to enforce password and credential validation policies directly within PostgreSQL.  

Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: The ip4r extension in Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server
value.description:
Now you can install the ip4r extension in Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server. Ip4r provides efficient storage and indexing functionality for IPv4 and IPv6 addresses and ranges.  
Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: Update pg_squeeze to version 1.9.1 in Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server
value.description:
Now you can upgrade the pg_squeeze extension to version 1.9.1 in Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server.  

Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server in Belgium Central
value.description:
Now you can deploy Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server in the Belgium Central Azure region.  
Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: Azure Load Balancer bandwidth metrics now support Protocol dimension
value.description:
Bandwidth metrics for Azure Load Balancer are now published with metric dimension Protocol. When retrieving or viewing Byte, Packet, and SYN Count metrics in the Azure portal, you will now see the dimension Protocol. TCP traffic is denoted by Protocol=6, while UDP traffic is represented by Protocol=17. 

With the Protocol dimension, you gain more granular visibility into traffic patterns for alerting, monitoring, and troubleshooting requirements. 

The Protocol dimension is available on Byte, Packet, and SYN Count metrics in all Azure public regions, China cloud regions, and Government cloud regions. 

Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: Perth - Azure Extended Zones
value.description:
We are announcing the general availability of the Perth Azure Extended Zone.   

Azure Extended Zones are small-footprint extensions of Azure placed in metro areas, industry centers, or specific jurisdictions, to serve low latency and data residency workloads. They support a selection of virtual machine (VMs), container, networking, storage, and other Azure services. Azure Extended Zones can run latency-sensitive and throughput-intensive applications close to end users, within data residency boundaries.  

Learn more about onboarding and managing Azure Extended Zones on our learn page, and start unlocking low-latency performance for your Perth workloads.

value.title: Generally Available: Model Context Protocol support in Azure API Management and Azure API Center
value.description:
Announcing the public preview of Model Context Protocol (MCP) support in Azure API Management and Azure API Center. With this new capability, enterprises can transform their existing APIs into dynamic, agent-ready tools, while improving security and simplifying management.  

 

Enhanced Security for MCP Servers:  

  • Apply gateway policies to protect MCP servers by enforcing authentication, authorization, rate limiting, and other security measures.  

Transform Existing APIs into MCP Servers:  

  • Easily expose any APIM-managed API as an MCP server, transforming your existing APIs into dynamic, agent-ready tools with minimal effort.  

Private MCP Registry for Enterprise Organizations:  

  • Use Azure API Center as a private remote MCP registry for your organization, giving you full control over what services are exposed.  

Streamlined MCP Discovery and Consumption:  

  • Expose APIs as MCP servers in Azure API Center (APIC) for a better developer experience and smoother API consumption.  

 

These features make it easier to secure, manage, and consume APIs in a way that supports advanced use cases like AI integrations, all while improving security and governance.  

Learn more.

value.title: Public Preview: Managed Identity support in Network Watcher VNET flow log, traffic analytics and packet capture
value.description:
VNET flow log captures IP traffic flowing through VNETs, subnets, and NICs for monitoring, troubleshooting, network optimization, security, and compliance needs and stores the logs in Azure Storage 

Traffic Analytics leverages VNET flow logs and aggregates, processes and enriches the flows to analyze traffic flow and offers insights into network activity, visualization, security, and performance. 

Network Watcher packet capture enables the capture of network packets directly from a virtual machine, helping users perform deep network analysis and diagnose issues. 

Managed identities provided by Microsoft Entra ID enables VNET flow logs and traffic analytics to securely access Azure Blob Storage and log analytics workspace respectively without the need to manage credentials. For more information, see What is managed identities for Azure resources. 

After you enable managed identity for Network Watcher VNET flow logs, traffic analytics, or packet capture by granting the managed identity necessary permissions will use the managed identity to obtain an access token from Microsoft Entra ID for accessing the specified resource.  

Learn more.

value.title: Public Preview: Claude Opus 4.5 Available in Microsoft Foundry
value.description:
Claude Opus 4.5 is now available in public preview on Microsoft Foundry, bringing advanced coding, agentic workflows, and enterprise productivity to Azure customers. Claude Opus 4.5 sets a new benchmark for performance and versatility, outperforming previous Claude models and delivering frontier intelligence at a more accessible price point. With seamless integration into Foundry Models, Playground, and Agent Service, organizations can build and scale AI solutions securely and efficiently. The model benefits from Azure’s enterprise-grade security and compliance, and supports use cases from software development to financial analysis and cybersecurity. Pricing starts at $5 per million input tokens and $25 per million output tokens, available in East US2 and Sweden Central regions. Get started today in the Foundry portal. 

Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: Azure File Sync in New Zealand North
value.description:
Azure File Sync enables seamless tiering of data from on-premises Windows Servers to Azure Files for hybrid use cases and simplified migration. It also enables you to leverage the performance, flexibility and compatibility of your on-premises File Server while leveraging the scale and cost effectiveness of Azure Files.

The expansion into New Zealand North brings the service closer to organizations in these regions, offering lower latency, better performance, and support for local data residency requirements.

If Azure File Sync is not yet available in your preferred region, please fill out this survey to express interest.  

Learn more.

value.title: Public Preview: Entra ID support for RDP connections
value.description:
Announcing Azure Bastion now supports Microsoft Entra ID authentication for RDP connections to Windows VMs directly in the portal. 

This update brings two key benefits for RDP users connecting to their virtual machines: 

  • Enhanced Security: By eliminating local authentication mechanisms, this feature reduces potential attack surfaces, helping customers strengthen their security posture. 
  • Seamless Access: With Microsoft Entra ID as the authentication method, users enjoy a simple, one-click sign-on experience—no extra credentials required. 

This is a big step forward in making secure and streamlined VM access easier than ever. 

Learn more:

  • about Microsoft Entra ID.

  • about Entra ID for RDP connections.

value.title: Generally Available: Azure MCP Server for Azure Database for MySQL
value.description:
Announcing that Azure MCP Server now supports Azure Database for MySQL. With this update, you can empower AI agents and applications to interact with your MySQL data using natural language through the open Model Context Protocol (MCP). Instead of writing complex queries, you can simply ask questions like “retrieve schema details for the customers table,” “show the last 7 days of failed orders,” or “summarize anomalies by region.” These interactions support Microsoft Entra authentication, eliminating password management and ensuring enterprise-grade security. 

 

By integrating MySQL tools into the Azure MCP Server alongside other services such as Azure AI Search, Azure Cosmos DB, and Azure Storage, you gain a unified interface for building intelligent, context-aware workflows. This consistency reduces integration complexity, accelerates development, and enables you to create agentic solutions that span data exploration, analysis, and operational actions—all within the trusted Azure ecosystem. 

 

You benefit from faster insights, simplified schema discovery, and the ability to automate MySQL-driven business logic without leaving your development environment. 

 

Get started today by installing Azure MCP Server in Visual Studio Code, enabling GitHub Copilot, and setting up Microsoft Entra authentication for Azure Database for MySQL. 

Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: Regex support in T-SQL
value.description:
Boost your SQL queries with powerful regular expressions (regex) support for advanced pattern matching. Now you can use native regex in T-SQL directly in Azure SQL and SQL Server 2025 queries—simplifying code, improving maintainability, and reducing dependency on external scripts. 

Learn more

value.title: Generally Available: Azure Load Testing in Italy North
value.description:
Azure Load Testing capability in Azure App Testing is now generally available in Italy North. Customers can now use Azure Load Testing, a fully managed load-testing service to generate high scale load and run simulations, easily identify performance bottlenecks through a rich dashboard of client-side and server-side metrics, get AI powered actionable insights, and integrate load tests into their CI/CD workflows. Customers can get started without any knowledge of load-testing tools, or use their existing Apache JMeter or Locust scripts.

Learn more:
  • about Azure Load Testing.
  • go to feedback forum.

value.title: Generally Available: Custom handler support in Azure Functions Flex consumption
value.description:
Azure Functions now supports custom handlers in Flex consumption. Custom handlers are lightweight web servers that receive events from the Functions host. Any language that supports HTTP primitives can implement a custom handler. 

 

Custom handlers are best suited for situations where you want to: 

  • Implement a function app in a language that's not currently offered out-of-the box, such as Go or Rust. 
  • Implement a function app in a runtime that's not currently featured by default, such as Deno.  

With custom handlers, you can use triggers and input and output bindings via extension bundles. 

Learn more:

  • Get started with Azure Functions custom handlers with quickstarts in Go and Rust.
  • Review the documentation.

value.title: Retirement: Migrate to dedicated VM for your compute clusters
value.description:
On September 30, 2025, Low-Priority VM will reach end of life. However, you will continue to be supported on Azure Machine Learning until March 31, 2026.  

To ensure that your clusters are not automatically scaled down it is recommended to migrate to dedicated VMs before that date.  

After March 31, 2026, you'll not be able to use your clusters with low-priority VM.  

 

Required action  

To ensure you're using a supported cluster, you can recreate your low-priority VM clusters with dedicated VM before March 31, 2026.  

Detailed guidance is documented here 

Help and support  

If you have questions, get answers from community experts in Microsoft Q&A. If you have a support plan and you need technical help, create a support case.  

Links provided herein may take you to a third-party website and are provided for convenience only. Third-party websites are subject to the third-party's terms and privacy statements.  

Learn more about service retirements that may impact your resources in the Azure Retirement Workbook. Please note that retirements may not be visible in the workbook for up to two weeks after being announced.

value.title: Public Preview: Container network metrics filtering in Advanced Container Networking Services for (ACNS) for AKS
value.description:
Container network metrics filtering in Azure Container Networking Services (ACNS) is now available in public preview.

 

In containerized environments, the ingestion of excessive network metrics can lead to inflated storage costs and cluttered dashboards, making it difficult to maintain observability efficiency. Azure Container Networking Services (ACNS) now offers container network metrics filtering, available in public preview, to address this challenge. 

This new capability enables users to define fine-grained filters at the Cilium level using a Custom Resource Definition (CRD), allowing metrics collection to be scoped by namespace or pod. By filtering metrics before they reach Prometheus, organizations can significantly reduce data volume, lower operational overhead, and improve the clarity of their observability tools.

Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: MCP support for AI toolchain operator add-on in AKS
value.description:
MCP support for AI toolchain operator add-on is now Generally Available.   

 

The AI Toolchain Operator add-on now supports KAITO inference workspaces with integrated tool calling and Model Context Protocol (MCP), addressing key challenges around dynamic model interaction and real-time data integration.  

 

Previously, developers faced friction deploying LLM-based services that needed external tool access, such as APIs or custom functions, often requiring bespoke orchestration. Now, you can benefit from seamless integration of KAITO’s vLLM-based tool calling with supported models, along with MCP support for connecting models to external systems in real time – to enable smarter, more context-aware AI services directly within AKS. 

Learn more:

  • about Integrate tool calling with LLM Inference with the AI toolchain operator add-on on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
  • about Integrate an MCP server with an LLM Inference Service on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)

value.title: Generally Available: Local redirect policy in Azure CNI powered by Cilium for AKS
value.description:
Local redirect policy with Azure CNI powered by Cilium for AKS is now generally available. 

Customers running high-scale AKS workloads often experience latency and performance bottlenecks due to cross-node traffic routing. The new local redirect policy addresses this by enabling node-local service routing, ensuring traffic is redirected to pods on the same node whenever possible. This results in lower latency, improved throughput, and enhanced reliability, especially critical for AI training and microservice-based applications.  

Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: Cluster-wide Cilium network policy with Azure CNI powered by Cilium for AKS
value.description:
Cluster-wide Cilium network policy for AKS clusters using Azure CNI powered by Cilium is now Generally Available.  

 

Managing consistent network policies across Kubernetes namespaces has long been a challenge for platform teams, especially in multi-tenant environments. With the general availability of cluster-wide Cilium network policy for AKS clusters using Azure CNI powered by Cilium, customers can now define and enforce network policies at the cluster level. This enhancement simplifies policy management and strengthens isolation between tenants by leveraging Cilium’s high-performance eBPF dataplane. 

Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: Azure NetApp Files single file restore from backup
value.description:
With Azure NetApp Files single file restore from backup, you can restore individual files from Azure NetApp Files backup vault without needing to restore an entire volume. By restoring only the necessary files, you can save time and cost needed for restoring data. This feature is available in all ANF supported region. 
Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: Layer 7 policy with Advanced Container Networking Services (ACNS) for AKS
value.description:
To address the growing need for granular traffic control in microservices architectures, Azure Container Networking Services now offers Layer 7 Policy as a generally available feature. This capability empowers customers to enforce fine-grained traffic controls at the application layer, supporting protocols such as HTTP, HTTPS, gRPC, and Kafka. By bridging gaps in zero-trust enforcement and microservice isolation, Layer 7 Policy enhances security posture, provides deeper traffic visibility, and simplifies policy management, all without compromising performance. 

Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: DNS security policy Threat Intelligence feed
value.description:
Azure DNS security policy Threat Intelligence feed is now generally available. Protect against known malicious domains with Microsoft’s managed Threat Intelligent feed. 

 

Smart Protection 

 

  • Almost all attacks begin with a DNS query. Threat Intelligence managed domain list enables you to detect and prevent security incidents early. 

 

 Continuous Updates 


  • The feed is automatically updated by Microsoft so that you stay protected against newly detected malicious domains.  

 

Monitor and Block 

  • You have the flexibility of just observing the activity in Alert only mode or block the suspected activity in blocking mode.  
  • Enabling logging feature gives you visibility into all DNS traffic in the virtual network.
Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: Azure Sphere OS version 25.10 is now available
value.description:
Azure Sphere OS version 25.10 is now available in the Retail feed. This release includes updates to Azure Sphere OS only; it does not include an updated SDK. If your devices are connected to the internet, they will receive the updated OS from the cloud.

This release includes quality and underlying build system updates.

For self-help inquiries or technical support, review the Azure Sphere support options.

value.title: Generally Available: Trusted Launch is now supported for Arm64 Marketplace Images
value.description:
Announcing that Trusted Launch supported Arm64 Images are now available in the Azure Marketplace. You can now get the dual benefit of cost and performance efficiencies of Arm64 in addition to the security benefits of Trusted Launch. 

 

Arm64 VMs bring cost savings, energy efficiency, and high performance to cloud workloads. 

 

Trusted Launch VMs provide foundational compute security to Azure VMs by enabling Secure Boot and vTPM capabilities. Trusted Launch protects OS against rootkits, boot kits and enables attestation by measuring the boot chain of VM. 

 

The Cobalt 100 based Arm64 VMs (Dpsv6/Dplsv6/Epsv6) support the Trusted Launch security type, and users can improve the security of their Cobalt 100 VMs by deploying with Trusted Launch images from the marketplace. Supported images include Ubuntu 24.04, Debian 13, Rocky 9, Azure Linux 3, RedHat Enterprise Linux 10, and more. 

Learn more:

  • about Trusted Launch.
  • about Cobalt 100 VMs.

value.title: Public Preview: Azure NetApp Files cache volumes
value.description:
Azure NetApp Files cache volumes are now available in public preview. The cache volumes feature is a new capability built on NetApp’s ONTAP FlexCache technology that provides a persistent, high-performance cache in Azure for data stored on ONTAP-based storage volumes outside of Azure NetApp Files. This feature enables organizations to cache active (“hot”) data closer to users and cloud applications, dramatically improving data access speeds and throughput over WAN connections. With cache volumes, you can burst on-premises datasets to Azure with near-local performance, which is ideal for scenarios such as running computational workloads in Azure or enabling globally distributed teams to collaborate without file transfer delays.   

 

Cache volumes is available in these regions. 

 

Learn more:   

  • What's new in Azure NetApp Files 

  • Configure a cache volume for Azure NetApp Files

value.title: Public Preview: Azure NetApp Files migration assistant (portal support)
value.description:
Azure NetApp Files migration assistant (with SnapMirror) provides efficient and cost-effective data migration leveraging ONTAP's built-in replication engine for seamless transition from on-premises or CVO/other cloud providers to Azure NetApp Files (ANF). This feature offers benefits aligned with the goal to accelerate and simplify migrations of business-critical applications and data to Azure. The feature is now available in Azure Portal and is now in Public Preview in all regions. 

 

Key Benefits 

  • Storage-efficient data transfer that reduces network transfer costs for both baseline and incremental updates 

  • Low cutover/downtime window ensuring faster and more efficient final updates, minimizing disruption to customer operations 

  • Volume migration using migration assistant includes source volume snapshots for primary data protection, and directory and file metadata maintaining security attributes 

Learn more: 

  • What’s new 

  • Migrate volumes to Azure NetApp Files | Microsoft Learn

value.title: Public Preview: Azure Monitor for Azure Arc-enabled Kubernetes with OpenShift and Azure Red Hat OpenShift
value.description:
Azure Monitor provides a complete set of services for monitoring the health and performance of different layers of your Kubernetes infrastructure and the applications that depend on it.

Azure Monitor now supports Azure Arc-enabled Kubernetes with OpenShift and Azure Red Hat OpenShift with Container Insights and Managed Prometheus.

Learn more.

value.title: Public Preview: 20 MB/s/TiB Performance Tier for Azure Managed Lustre
value.description:
Azure Managed Lustre now offers a new 20 MB/s/TiB performance tier in public preview, designed to meet the demands of large-scale AI and high-performance computing (HPC) workloads. This tier enables customers to provision file systems up to 25 PiB in a single namespace, delivering up to 512 GB/s of bandwidth and supporting up to 20 billion inodes for massive file counts.

The 20 MB/s/TiB tier uses Lustre’s DNE2 multi-MDS architecture, adding one MDS per 5 PiB to enable directory striping across multiple metadata targets. This boosts metadata operations, delivering over 5× higher IOPS in mdtest benchmarks as striping scales. Ideal for AI training and HPC workloads, it ensures high metadata throughput and efficient handling of massive datasets.

By offering a lower bandwidth density option, customers can optimize costs while scaling to larger namespaces, consolidating workloads into a single, high-performance file system and simplifying their architecture.

To request access to the public preview, please fill out this form.

value.title: Generally Available: CSI Dynamic Provisioning for Azure Managed Lustre
value.description:
CSI Dynamic Provisioning for Azure Managed Lustre (AMLFS) is now generally available. With dynamic provisioning, Kubernetes applications can request AMLFS-backed persistent volumes on demand using standard StorageClass and PersistentVolumeClaim objects—no pre‑provisioning of volumes is required. This simplifies day-to-day operations for AI/ML training, simulation, and high‑throughput analytics that rely on POSIX file semantics and shared access at scale.

This GA supports Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters running Kubernetes 1.21 and later and uses the Azure Lustre CSI driver. Dynamic provisioning is supported in driver version v0.3.0 and later. Node pools must use the Ubuntu Linux OS SKU.

Administrators define a StorageClass that references an AMLFS file system; developers then bind PVCs to create AMLFS volumes automatically. The driver integrates with the AMLFS client (Lustre 2.15.x) and follows the Kubernetes CSI specification.

Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: Azure Managed Lustre Support for Azure MCP Server
value.description:
Azure Managed Lustre now offers full integration with Azure MCP Server, and this capability is generally available. Azure MCP Server enables developers and infrastructure teams to manage Azure resources—including Azure Managed Lustre file systems—using natural language prompts, streamlining operations for AI training and high-performance computing (HPC) environments.

With this integration, you can create, list, and manage Azure Managed Lustre file systems directly from supported IDEs (such as Visual Studio Code, Visual Studio, and IntelliJ) or via automation scripts, using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). The Azure Managed Lustre tools for MCP Server support advanced configuration options, including specifying network, capacity, maintenance windows, availability zones, and encryption settings. This makes it easier to provision and operate scalable, high-performance Lustre file systems for large-scale simulation, model training, and fine-tuning workloads.

Azure MCP Server provides secure, role-based access and supports a wide range of Azure services, enabling unified management and automation for modern AI and HPC pipelines.

Learn more.

value.title: Public Preview: Auto-import for Azure Managed Lustre
value.description:
The Auto-import feature for Azure Managed Lustre (AMLFS) is now available in public preview. Auto-import enables seamless, policy-driven synchronization of data from Azure Blob Storage containers into AMLFS clusters, automatically reflecting new, changed, or deleted blobs in the Lustre namespace. This feature supports hybrid workflows where data is generated in Blob and consumed in AMLFS.

Customers can configure import policies per Blob container–AMLFS cluster pair, specifying which types of changes are imported and how conflicts are resolved. This flexibility supports a range of scenarios, including post-deployment ingestion, machine learning pipelines, and continuous data synchronization for analytics workloads. Auto-import helps unify object and file-based workflows, enabling near real-time data sharing and reducing operational overhead by eliminating the need for manual import scripts or intermediate file servers.

Operational efficiency is further enhanced by allowing customers to select conflict resolution policies and control whether deletions in Blob are reflected in AMLFS. These capabilities provide native integration with Azure Blob Storage and the Azure ecosystem.

Learn more.

value.title: Public Preview: Recommended alerts for Azure Monitor Workspace
value.description:
Azure Monitor now offers one-click enablement of recommended alerts directly in the Azure Portal for Azure Monitor Managed service for Prometheus customers. These alerts enable you to monitor the ingestion limits for Azure Monitor Workspace and avoid metrics throttling.
Learn more

value.title: Public Preview: Azure Managed Redis integration with Microsoft Foundry
value.description:
Azure Managed Redis is now available as part of the Microsoft Foundry MCP tools catalog, allowing customers to use Redis as a knowledge store or memory store for AI agents. This integration makes it simple to connect Redis to Foundry-based agents, enabling semantic searching, long term and short term memory, and faster reasoning for multi-agent applications—all running on trusted Azure infrastructure.
Learn more:
  • About Azure Managed Redis.
  • About what's new in Azure Managed Redis.
  • Try Azure Managed Redis samples on GitHub

value.title: Public Preview: Azure API Management adds support for A2A Agent APIs
value.description:
Announcing the public preview of A2A API support in Azure API Management. With this new capability, organizations can manage and govern agent APIs alongside other API types — AI model APIs, Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools, and traditional APIs such as REST, SOAP, and GraphQL. 

This update empowers customers to extend their established API governance and security practices into the evolving agentic ecosystem, strengthening secure access, enforcing policies consistently, and ensuring observability for AI agents. 

A2A APIs in Azure API Management offer advanced mediation of JSON-RPC runtime operations with robust policy support, enable agent card exposure to agents, users, or clients, and provide comprehensive tracing aligned with the OpenTelemetry GenAI semantic convention. 

Additionally, you now have the option to register A2A APIs in Azure API Center, enabling organization-wide discovery and governance of agent APIs. 

Learn more.

value.title: Public Preview: Azure Databricks Genie in Copilot Studio
value.description:
Azure Databricks Genie is now available in Microsoft Copilot Studio, giving you direct access to intelligent, enterprise-grade AI answers across your full Azure Databricks data estate. This integration unlocks enterprise-grade, conversational analytics across your data estate—no code required. Through Model Context Protocol (MCP), Copilot Studio agents can now deliver richer, more accurate responses grounded in your actual business data. You can instantly publish Genie-powered agents to Microsoft Teams and Microsoft 365 to accelerate decision-making and empower users at every level. 

 

Bringing Azure Databricks Genie capabilities into daily collaboration helps your teams save time, reduce errors, and eliminate barriers to advanced analytics. The unified platform amplifies your ability to act quickly and drive better outcomes, all while reinforcing the value of open, extensible interoperability across the Microsoft ecosystem.  

Learn more.

value.title: Public Preview: Microsoft Foundry data connection for Azure Databricks
value.description:
Azure Databricks Genie is now integrated with Microsoft Foundry and in public preview. You can now connect Genie spaces directly to Microsoft Foundry agents using Model Context Protocol (MCP), giving you seamless access to trusted data for building intelligent workflows.  

 

This release simplifies AI development by streamlining data connectivity, boosting governance, and accelerating time-to-value. You can spend less time setting up your data environment and more time building intelligent solutions that take advantage of the Microsoft unified platform for data, AI, and governance to drive business value. 

 

Whether you're scaling AI or unifying your data strategy, integration of Genie and Microsoft Foundry helps you do more—securely and efficiently. 

Learn more.

value.title: Generally Available: TLS and TCP termination on Azure Application Gateway
value.description:
Azure Application Gateway has introduced general availability support for TLS and TCP protocol termination. This enhancement enables you to load balance and securely process non-HTTP(S) traffic for applications that rely on TCP or TLS protocols. The gateway terminates the incoming connection at the proxy and establishes a new connection to the backend servers. The TLS certificate management is available for both HTTPS and TLS protocols on a resource, simplifying the certificate operations and providing a single endpoint for clients. 

With this release, the TLS/TCP proxy also brings support for Client IP preservation using the PROXY protocol header, as well as support for port 22 on listeners. 

This capability is available on Application Gateway Standard v2 and WAF v2 SKUs. 

Learn more.

value.title: Public Preview: Claude in Microsoft Foundry
value.description: Claude models by Anthropic are now available for Public Preview in Microsoft Foundry, expanding the platform’s unified ecosystem of frontier AI. Enterprises can access Claude Sonnet 4.5, Opus 4.1, and Haiku 4.5 for advanced long-context reasoning, coding, and multimodal comprehension—integrated across Foundry Models, Playground, and Agent Service. Importantly, Claude is offered within the global standard deployment type, ensuring that organizations can leverage these models with consistent availability, enterprise-grade support, and compliance across worldwide Azure regions. This makes it straightforward for customers to deploy and scale Claude-powered solutions wherever they operate, benefiting from Microsoft’s trusted infrastructure and governance. This launch marks a major milestone in Microsoft’s open, interoperable AI strategy, empowering customers to build agentic systems, automate workflows, and ground Claude in enterprise data with full observability, security, and Responsible AI. With Claude joining over 11,000 other models, Foundry offers the broadest model choice and seamless integration with Azure services, making it the only enterprise platform to unify all major model families in one governed environment.

value.title: Public Preview: Azure Copilot agents - a closer look at the deployment agent
value.description:
Following our Azure Copilot announcement introducing agentic capabilities, this update focuses on one of the six new agents: the deployment agent. The deployment agent helps you discover, plan, and deploy cloud workloads faster and with confidence using natural language guidance. Through ongoing dialogues, the deployment agent captures requirements and delivers real-time guidance to plan and deploy workloads, reducing complexity and errors.  

Using the Azure Well-Architected Framework, the agent recommends best-practice architectures and offers tailored suggestions—from optimal pre-built templates to custom IaC—ensuring deployments are fast, intuitive, and robust.  

With the Azure Copilot deployment agent, users benefit from:  

  • Intelligent workload recommendations based on Azure’s Well Architected Framework pillars.  
  • Step-by-step guidance for planning and deploying infrastructure.  
  • Optimal pre-built template selection or customized IaC that meets user needs.  
  • Ability to pull custom IaC to users Git Hub repositories or VS Code Web based deployment.   

To access Azure Copilot’s agents, including this one, please use this form.

Learn more.
